meanings.definition: The study of the physiological processes underlying disease.
meanings.sent1: In physiopathology, scientists investigate how the body's functions change during illness.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use physiopathology to understand how diseases affect the body.
meanings.sent3: Learning about physiopathology can help medical students grasp the complexities of illness.
meanings.sent4: The book explained physiopathology in a way that made disease processes clearer.
meanings.sent5: Studying physiopathology is like deciphering the body's secret code of sickness.

meanings.definition: The abnormal physiological processes associated with disease.
meanings.sent1: The doctor analyzed the patient's physiopathology to diagnose the underlying condition.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the physiopathology of a disease is crucial for effective treatment.
meanings.sent3: The physiopathology of the rare illness puzzled even the most experienced physicians.
meanings.sent4: Her research shed light on the mysterious physiopathology of the genetic disorder.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing the physiopathology firsthand made the medical student realize the severity of the disease.
